column4: How does Ubuntu decide how and when to use swap space?  It never seems to be using very much to me, and I was wondering if using more would free up more memory/speed thing up.
using swap is *bad*
its tens of thousands times slower than ram
blue-frog: Ah, okay.  (Coming from Windows, where there is not such thing.)
NFS is very nice for filesharing between 2 computers
mount the networked share
sudo mount -t (smbfs/nfs) -o user=XXX,password=XXX //computername/share /mountpoint
Thanks.  Also, I have them connected via the Gnome Connect To dialogue; does that create a mounted share somewhere or does it work differently?
dunno how that works.. dont think it actually mounts, but i dont know as i never really use it
it might even go via ssh, for my "fix" you need either a Samba or NFS share
It is via ssh, but I don't know how that works, just that it did.
dont think you can actually mount stuff thru ssh
i suppose it uses 'scp' over ssh...
im not too familliar with it
Okay, I'll tinker around.  I've done samba for something once before, thought I'd check out ssh to see what it did too.
http://linux.suramya.com/tutorials/Install_GIMPShop/ - the deb package is listed in section 4.0 at the bottom.
thx, but it's fo debian and breaks the ubuntugimp :(
Really?  Would doing it from sorce be better then?
thinking of compiliing itt yes

think i'll compile it's dependancy and use the .deb  :)
ty tho :)
